= New Structure (beta)=

Regarding [http://code.google.com/p/openmeetings/issues/detail?id=353 Issue 353]


{{{
TOP
|-- main.lzx         <== main lzx
|-- maindebug.lzx    <== main lzx with debug=true
|-- index.jsp        <== jsp file
|-- config.xml       <== configuration file
|-- test_*.*         <== test files
|-- *.swf            <== swf files
|-- swfobject.js     <== js library
|
|-- /doc        <== lzxdoc directory
|
|-- /test       <== test files directory
|
|-- /resources  <== resource files directory
|    |-- *.jpg
|    |-- *.gif
|    |-- *.png
|    |-- *.swf
| 
|-- /base
|    |
|    |-- /components         <== common base components for all modules
|    |-- etc,etc,etc,....
|    |--
|    |-- mainAttributes.lzx  <== global <attribute>
|    |-- mainDatasets.lzx    <== global <dataset>
|    |-- mainMethods.lzx     <== global <script> and <method>
| 
|-- /modules
     |
     |-- /conference         <== conference specific modules
     |-- /auth
     |-- /admin
     |-- /backup
     |-- /chat
     |-- /navi
     |-- /recording
     |-- /upload
     |-- etc,etc,etc,....
}}}   
||main.lzx ||All <attribute>,<script>,<method>,<dataset> is in another lzx. main.lzx only include them. main.lzx has basic <view> and <handler>. ||
||/base||Minimum requirement for Openmeetings, as it means, /base is Openmeetings Core. Includes base-classes, common components and libraries for modules.||
||/modules||Pluggable modules.(=plugins). A new module must be in the modules directory. Every module directory structure does not have any restriction. To select modules, rewrite include statements by admin tools(in the future release).||
